text: The 1906 Summer Olympics, also called the 1906 Intercalated Games, were held in Athens, Greece.Sports Reference.com (SR/Olympics), "1906 Athina Summer Games" ; retrieved 2012-8-14. These games are not awarded the title of Olympiad because they were held between the III and IV Olympiads. Medals were given to the participants during these games, but the medals are not officially recognised by the International Olympic Committee. == Participants nations == Athletes from 20 nations took part in the St. Louis games. * * * * * * * * FinlandThe Grand Duchy of Finland was part of the Russian Empire at the time, but was treated as a separate nation. * * * * * * * * * * * Ottoman EmpireAt the 1908 Olympics, the name "Turkey" was used to refer to the Ottoman Empire. * ==Related pages== * List of IOC country codes ==References == ==Other websites== Olympics Category:Summer Olympics in Europe Summer Olympic 1906 Category:20th century in Greece
